intro: Psychotria guadalupensis, commonly known as the Guadalupan psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Mexico, specifically the state of Guanajuato, where it grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant features small, dark green leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is often found in cloud forests and is adapted to thrive in high humidity and moderate temperatures. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
